IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide affordable faculty and staff housing for the University of California, Irvine.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Organization was created by the Regents of the University of California for the purpose of developing and maintaining affordable faculty and staff housing on the campus of the University of California, Irvine. The Organization is a sec. 509(a)(3) supporting organization to the University of California, Irvine.
IRS990.Desc: The Irvine Campus Housing Authority develops and maintains affordable housing and related facilities for the use of faculty and staff of the University of California, Irvine.

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Regents of the University of California at Irvine

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: Premiums on Notes Payable to the UC Regents, net

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Irvine Campus Housing Authority has no unrecognized tax benefits associated with uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2018 and 2017.

In May 2015, the Board of Directors adopted the Retiree Health Reimbursement Plan (the "Plan"). The purpose of the Plan is to provide a reimbursement of up to $5,000 per year toward certain medical expenses for each eligible retiree and his or her spouse and dependents. Employees are eligible for the plan upon retirement if (1) they are at least 62.5 years of age and have at least 15 years of full-time service with ICHA, or (2) are at least 70 years of age and have at least 14 years of full-time service with ICHA. The Board of Directors has the right to amend or terminate the Plan at any time. No payments were made under the Plan to any person listed on Form 990, Part VII, Section A, Line 1a. On October, 12, 2018, the board of directors terminated the Retiree Health Reimbursement Plan. The termination effective date is December 31, 2019.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: According to the Organization's bylaws, all directors of the Organization shall be appointed by the Chancellor of University of California, Irvine, with the approval of the President of the University of California.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In accordance with the ground lease agreement between the Organization and The Regents of the University of California and other documents, certain decisions made by the Organization acting as lessee are subject to the approval of The Regents or their delegates.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Audit Committee shall have the responsibility for reviewing the Organization's Form 990 (including all pertinent Schedules) before it is filed with the Internal Revenue Service. -A draft of the Form 990 should be ready for review by the Audit Committee with sufficient time for review prior to the filing deadline. -In conducting their review of the draft of the Form 990, it is preferred that the Audit Committee shall conduct a top-level or big-picture type of review. However, if the Audit Committee desires or deems it necessary to conduct a more detailed review of the Form 990, then they should contact the preparer of the Form 990 to request copies of the relevant detailed tax return workpapers which they would like to see. -Following the review of the Form 990 by the Audit Committee, the Board receives a copy of the Form 990 prior to it being filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All directors and employees are required to sign our conflict of interest policy in July of each year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Changes in salaries and other compensation for all of the Organization's senior managers are determined on an annual basis by the full Board of Directors in consultation with the Compensation and Benefits committee consisting of four Board members none of whom have any financial interest in the outcome of the determination.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The following documents of the Organization are available for inspection at the Organization's main office during normal business hours: Tax Exemption Application (Form 1023), Internal Revenue Service Determination Letter, Articles of Incorporation, By-Laws, and audited financial statements. -The public inspection copy of the Organization's Form 990 from the previous three years (at a minimum), will be available for inspection at the Organization's main office during normal business hours. -When responding to a public inspection request for any organizational document or Form 990 by anyone, the Organization shall fulfill such request in a timely fashion without inquiring as to the reason for the public inspection request.

The Audit Committee reviews and approves all audit activity, including tax returns. The Audit Committee receives, reviews, and responds to information, inquiries, and reports from the auditors and confers with them regarding the Organization's financial affairs. The Audit Committee advises the Board regarding the presentation and the acceptance of the annual audit report and Form 990.
Amount represents two notes payable, of which one note in the amount of $11,115,000 is payable to The UC Regents.
